intro: Toxicoscordion brevibracteatum, commonly known as the western golden thread, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and some poisonous species. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. However, it is toxic, containing compounds that can cause severe gastrointestinal distress if ingested.
